verses.text: A Song of degrees. To thee I raise my eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.
Behold, as the eyes of servants lookto the hand of their masters, andas the eyes of a maiden to the hand of her mistress; so our eyes waitupon the LORD our God, until he shall have mercy upon us.
Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us; for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.
Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, andwith the contempt of the proud.
